skill.name: daily-meeting-update
skill.description: Interactive daily standup/meeting update generator. Use when user says 'daily', 'standup', 'scrum update', 'status update', 'what did I do yesterday', 'prepare for meeting', 'morning update', or 'team sync'. Pulls activity from GitHub, Jira, and Claude Code session history. Conducts 4-question interview (yesterday, today, blockers, discussion topics) and generates formatted Markdown update.
skill.author: softaworks

security_audit.summary: Static scanner flagged 105 patterns in documentation (SKILL.md, README.md) and code. All findings are FALSE POSITIVES. External commands are documentation strings showing bash syntax, not actual execution. Filesystem access is limited to Claude Code session data in ~/.claude/projects. Network patterns are static GitHub URLs in docs. The Python script (claude_digest.py) only reads local JSONL files using standard libraries.

content.value_statement: Preparing daily standup updates takes time and often misses context. This skill conducts a structured 4-question interview and pulls activity data from GitHub, Jira, and Claude Code to generate a complete Markdown update in seconds.
actual_capabilities: Conducts a 4-question interview (yesterday, today, blockers, discussion topics)
Pulls GitHub activity (commits, PRs, reviews) with user consent
Pulls Jira ticket updates from the last 24 hours
Parses Claude Code session history to recall work not in git/Jira
Generates formatted Markdown output with all sections
limitations: Requires user interaction to answer interview questions
Claude Code history is only available when Claude Code is used
GitHub and Jira integration requires CLI tools to be installed and authenticated
Does not integrate with other chat platforms or tools

use_cases.title: Daily standup preparation
use_cases.description: Generate a complete daily standup update by answering 4 structured questions while Claude pulls activity data from connected tools.

use_cases.title: Meeting summary for async updates
use_cases.description: Create a written status update for team members who could not attend the standup meeting.

use_cases.title: Work retrospective and planning
use_cases.description: Use the interview process to reflect on yesterday's accomplishments and plan today's priorities.

prompt_templates.title: Quick standup
prompt_templates.prompt: I need my daily standup update. Can you help me prepare it?

prompt_templates.title: With GitHub data
prompt_templates.prompt: Prepare my standup. I want to include my recent commits and PRs from the backend-api repo.

prompt_templates.title: Full integration
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate my daily meeting update. Include GitHub activity, Jira tickets, and my Claude Code session history from yesterday.

prompt_templates.title: Weekly retro
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create a summary of what I accomplished this week using my Claude Code sessions and git history.

output_examples.input: Help me prepare my daily standup
output: - Architecture of the new payments module

best_practices: Always ask for consent before pulling data from GitHub, Jira, or Claude Code history
Show pulled data during the interview to trigger memory and prompt additional items
Limit the update to 15 bullets maximum to keep it concise
Complete all 4 questions before generating the final update
anti_patterns: Running gh or jira commands without user consent first
Skipping the interview even when tool data is available
Including raw commit messages instead of summarizing outcomes
Asking for data after the interview instead of before

faq.question: What tools does this skill integrate with?
faq.answer: The skill integrates with GitHub CLI, Jira CLI, Atlassian MCP, and Claude Code session history. All integrations require user consent before accessing data.

faq.question: Does this skill make network requests?
faq.answer: No. The skill only reads local files. GitHub and Jira data is pulled using CLI tools if installed, which may make network requests separately.

faq.question: Where is my Claude Code session data stored?
faq.answer: Sessions are read from ~/.claude/projects/*/*.jsonl files. The script only reads from this specific directory.

faq.question: Can I skip the interview and just use tool data?
faq.answer: No. The interview is required because tools capture what happened but miss context like research, meetings, and planning decisions.

faq.question: What if Claude Code history is not available?
faq.answer: The skill gracefully falls back to GitHub, Jira, or just the interview. Missing integrations do not block the workflow.
